items.title: RBI wants groups to untie their NBFC knots
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is urging large business groups to consolidate their non-banking finance and investment companies. This move aims to simplify structures for better risk assessment and regulatory oversight. Groups with multiple NBFCs, especially those with overlapping businesses, are being advised to merge entities.

items.title: 'Safeguards' slowing down access to breakthrough drugs in India
items.summary: New drugs are not reaching low and middle income countries. A study shows many medicines take years to become accessible globally. India's regulatory system needs to mature for quicker access to breakthrough therapies. Stronger intellectual property protection and global standardisation are key. This will help reduce delays in drug availability for patients.

items.title: Hotels hit as companies ground travel amid flight issues
items.summary: Even as IndiGo chief executive Peter Elbers said operations were "fully stabilised" and that the carrier operated more than 1,800 flights on Tuesday, companies are taking a cautious approach. Hospitality industry insiders said cancellations were coming in, but they expect the crisis to cause only a temporary blip in performance in a usually busy quarter.

items.title: BlackRock To Invest Rs 3,000 Crore For Minority Stake In Aditya Birla Renewables

items.title: Fresh troubles loom for IndiGo as CCI likely to launch inquiry

items.summary: Insurance companies have approached the Union government to join the Fastag system. They want to issue Fastag stickers, citing their role in a vehicle's life cycle. This move could benefit new-age general insurers, as vehicle insurance is a significant part of their business. Discussions are ongoing and in early stages.

items.title: Mehul Choksi's Appeal Against India's Extradition Request Rejected By Belgium Supreme Court
items.summary: The Court of Appeals had ruled that Choksi, the main accused in a Rs-13,000 crore PNB scam, faces 'no risk' of being denied a fair trial or subjected to ill-treatment if he is extradited to India.

items.title: Civil Aviation Minister Naidu blames IndiGo’s 'internal mess' for disruptions, says penalties will follow
items.summary: IndiGo flight cancellations: Civil Aviation Minister K. Ram Mohan Naidu defended the government's handling of flight disruptions, placing blame on IndiGo for failing to manage its crew and rostering systems. He asserted that the airline's crisis stemmed from operational lapses, despite multiple consultations and adequate preparation time for all carriers regarding new pilot duty norms.

items.title: Paramount's $102 billion bid to sideline Netflix and buy Warner Bros Discovery — What you should expect
items.summary: In its bid to persuade Warner Bros Discovery shareholders, Paramount Skydance launched a tender offer for current WBD shares at $30 per share, all cash.

items.title: CBI books Anil Ambani's son, Reliance Home Finance in ₹228-crore bank fraud case
items.summary: CBI acted on a complaint filed by Union Bank of India against Reliance Home Finance, Jai Anmol Anil Ambani and Ravindra Sharad Sudhakar, both directors in RHFL

items.title: Why less trading might actually work better for you, Zerodha co-founder Nithin Kamath explains
items.summary: Nithin Kamath argued that increased trading activity reduces profitability for retail investors. He highlighted Zerodha’s model of discouraging frequent trades, resulting in significantly lower brokerage revenue compared to peers. By avoiding nudges that push volumes and not incentivising employees on revenue, Zerodha aims to promote thoughtful participation and long-term investor retention.

items.title: Zoho launches new billing and spend tools for enterprise users
items.summary: “The 2 new solutions will help finance teams monetise with modern revenue strategies, improve spend controls, streamline procurement, and gain end-to-end financial visibility”

items.title: EU-Google antitrust case: European Commission opens probe against tech giant over market dominance using AI tools
items.summary: EU-Google antitrust case: European Commission, has opened an investigation into Google, alleging that the company has abused its market dominance using artificial intelligence (AI) tools to squeeze competitors.&nbsp;

items.title: Indian property developer RMZ said to weigh $1 billion IPO
items.summary: RMZ Corp., one of India’s largest real estate developers, is reportedly exploring a potential IPO that could raise up to $1 billion, positioning it to deliver one of the biggest listings in the sector since DLF’s landmark issue in 2007. The Bengaluru-based firm has initiated early talks with bankers, though specifics like timing and structure may evolve.

items.title: Indus Towers stock: Recovery story or value trap?
items.summary: Vodafone Idea’s potentially improving prospects bode well for Indus. But capex-driven strain on cash flows along with a falling tenancy ratio and persistently negative energy margins pose hurdles.

items.title: Everyone knows social media is hurting children: When will policymakers act in their defence?
items.summary: Whistleblowers, parents and state prosecutors in the US say Big Tech has done little to shield children from the harms of social media, evidence of which is too glaring to ignore. Are policymakers much too beholden to Big Tech?

items.title: CBI books Anil Ambani’s son, Reliance Home Finance Ltd. in ₹228 crore bank fraud case
items.summary: The CBI acted on a complaint from the bank (erstwhile Andhra Bank) against Reliance Home Finance Ltd., Jai Anmol Anil Ambani and Ravindra Sharad Sudhakar, both directors in RHFL

items.title: Brakes India acquires 10% shareholding in Japan’s TBK through primary capital infusion
items.summary: Recently, both signed business alliance agreement; will mutually complement each other’s technological strengths and customer bases to the fullest extent

items.title: Higher tariff on Indian rice will burden US consumers, India looking for new markets: Experts
items.summary: The GTRI said the announcement made on December 8 alongside a new US farm relief package appears to be election-season communication targeted at U.S. farmers

items.title: Expert view: Market returns to be healthy in 2026; small-cap valuations expensive, says Mirae Asset's Head of Research
items.summary: In an exclusive interview, Mirae Asset's Head of Research reveals a bullish outlook for the Indian stock market in 2026, emphasizing strong domestic liquidity, improving consumption, and selective stock picking as key strategies for investors navigating the volatile landscape.

items.title: Google faces EU antitrust investigation into AI Overviews, YouTube
items.summary: Google faces an EU antitrust investigation into its use of web publishers’ online content and YouTube videos for AI, the European Commission said

items.title: ‘Buy’ calls pour in for Suzlon as analysts see 55% upside despite a 29% slide from the peak. Here's why
items.summary: Suzlon Energy shares remain in bear territory, but four major brokerages  Anand Rathi, ICICI Securities, Motilal Oswal, and Nuvama have turned bullish, projecting up to 55% upside driven by strong order books, capacity expansion, export readiness, and improving wind energy demand.

items.title: Warner Music India, Rthyms.Life partner to amplify India’s global sound
items.summary: Warner Music India has joined forces with Rhythms.Life. This collaboration aims to boost Indian music and artists on the world stage. Emerging talent will gain wider global exposure. Rhythms.Life is a creator-focused platform. It empowers artists with control over their careers.

items.title: Adani Energy Solutions, Adani Green see Moody’s outlook raised to stable; ratings affirmed
items.summary: Moody’s revises its outlook to stable for key Adani Group energy and renewable subsidiaries, affirming their ratings on the back of steady operations, predictable cash flows and fully amortising debt structures, while noting manageable risks tied to weak state discoms and long-term licence periods.

items.title: Why even ‘premium’ OTT plans in India can’t escape the ad onslaught and it is driving viewers away
items.summary: Indian OTT platforms face viewer fatigue due to repetitive and lengthy ad breaks. Experts emphasize the need for improved ad experiences and transparency to regain user trust and prevent subscription cancellations amid growing customer frustration.

items.title: Sensex extends losses but Sushil Kedia sees the index above 1,00,000 by 2026; lists big stock bets
items.summary: The Indian stock market continued to decline, with the Sensex dropping over 700 points and the Nifty 50 down 1%. Despite this, market expert Sushil Kedia believes long-term growth remains possible, forecasting Sensex above 1 lakh and Nifty reaching 28,000 in 2026.

items.title: Gautam Adani announces dual talent initiatives at IIT-Dhanbad
items.summary: The Adani Annual Internships at IIT Dhanbad will offer 50 third-year students meeting their merit and fitment criteria paid internships; 25% of these interns will also receive pre-employment offers

items.title: Donald Trump's basmati bluster: Will it matter to India?
items.summary: Donald Trump's hinting of new tariffs on Indian rice imports has sent shockwaves through Indian markets, causing rice stock prices to plummet. While the US is a small export market, the move signals potential trade friction ahead of upcoming bilateral talks. India's dominant global rice export position, however, offers resilience against such disruptions.

items.title: Piramal Finance clarifies after reports suggest talks with Keertana Finserv
items.summary: ​The clarification comes amid broader market speculation that Piramal Finance -- a non-deposit taking NBFC with ₹91,500 crore in assets under management (AUM) as of September -- is evaluating a push into the fast-growing gold loan segment.

items.title: MFs double down on 12 smallcap stocks; 2 deliver double-digit gains in just 2 months
items.summary: September 2025 shareholding data shows that MFs increased their stakes in nearly 380 listed companies compared with the June quarter.

items.title: Dharmesh Shah sees strong support at 25,500–25,700; expects Nifty to rebound towards 26,100 soon
items.summary: Indian markets saw pressure with Nifty dipping below key support. Analysts believe this is a healthy correction within a bull trend. Nifty is expected to find support and bounce back. Largecap stocks are preferred for stability. L&T is highlighted as a top pick with potential for significant gains. Investors can look for buying opportunities in the current dip.

items.title: European shares flat on caution ahead of Fed's rate decision
items.summary: European shares were muted on Tuesday, as caution lingered ahead of the U.S. Federal Reserve's two-day policy meeting starting later in the day, while gains in financial and industrial stocks kept the index afloat.

items.title: Emkay Global sees up to 26% upside for IndiGo, expects operations to normalise
items.summary: Emkay Global maintains a BUY on IndiGo-parent InterGlobe Aviation with a target of Rs 6,300, citing a potential 28.6% upside. The brokerage notes that recent operational disruptions caused over 4,200 cancellations, but expects normalization from December 10. Crew shortages, regulatory reviews, and elevated costs may weigh on near-term results, yet operational recovery could support a rebound in coming quarters.

items.title: Meesho IPO listing tomorrow: Here’s what GMP, subscription status, expert hint ahead of debut
items.summary: Meesho IPO listing is set for December 10, with shares credited to demat accounts today. The IPO attracted strong interest, especially from institutional buyers, and was priced between  ₹105 and  ₹111. The expected listing price is  ₹146, reflecting a premium in the grey market.

items.title: Indian Oil Corp seeks LNG cargo for January delivery, sources say
items.summary: Indian Oil Corporation has issued a tender for a liquefied natural gas cargo.  The delivery is scheduled for January 20.  The cargo is expected to arrive at the Dahej terminal.  The tender process will conclude on December 9.  This move signals India's ongoing energy procurement efforts.

items.title: Parliament Winter Session: Govt cancels 5,371 licences of fertiliser firms for malpractices during Apr-Nov, says JP Nadda
items.summary: The government has cancelled over 5,000 licenses of fertiliser companies. These firms faced action for black marketing, hoarding, and distributing substandard materials. Union Minister Jagat Prakash Nadda informed the Rajya Sabha about these measures. The Centre is taking action under various acts to curb malpractices. Show-cause notices were issued to thousands of firms. FIRs were lodged in hundreds of cases.

items.title: India’s import bill is likely to rise. Courtesy love for gold & gadgets amid rupee pain
items.summary: India's import bill is surging due to a weakening rupee, high global prices for gold and crude oil, and continued reliance on imported electronics. This has widened the trade deficit significantly, with the rupee hitting record lows and gold prices climbing. Despite 'Make in India' efforts, high-value electronic components remain a major import cost.

items.title: Commercial coal mining helps India add 74,000 jobs in 2024, says IEA
items.summary: Coal supply jobs have seen a resurgence in India, China and Indonesia in recent years, leading to global employment levels 8% higher in 2024 than in 2019, despite a 20% decline in advanced economies over that period

items.title: Luxury Time IPO allotment date likely today. GMP, steps to check share allotment status online for SME IPO
items.summary: Luxury Time IPO allotment date is likely today, 9 December 2025. Investors can check Luxury Time IPO allotment status online through the websites of BSE and the IPO registrar. MAS Services is the Luxury Time IPO registrar.

items.title: Intervene quickly: Urban India’s boom could end in misery if healthcare goes from bad to worse
items.summary: Behind India’s soaring urban aspirations lies a troubling truth: survey findings show uneven access to health services, falling financial coverage and sharp divergences in care-seeking behaviour. India must do something about this before it gets too late.

items.title: India home prices to rise at steady 6% pace but luxury sector may lose steam - Reuters poll
items.summary: Home prices in India will rise at roughly 6% in the coming two years but most real estate analysts polled by Reuters say the boom in the luxury housing sector currently driving the market will peter out within five years.

items.title: Michael Burry owns ‘sizable’ Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac common stock, believes re-listing for both ‘nearly upon us’
items.summary: Investor Michael Burry in his blog Cassandra Unchained, said he holds sizable positions in both Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac common stock. He also believes that a re-listing of the two US housing-finance giants is a close possibility.&nbsp;

items.summary: EUROPE-STOCKS/ (URGENT):European shares flat on caution ahead of Fed's rate decision

items.summary: Warehousing and industrial real estate platform Welspun One plans to develop Grade-A logistics park spread over around 1.2 million square feet in Talegaon, Pune with an investment of Rs 550 crore, the company said on Tuesday.

items.title: Small-cap stock jumps over 4% despite stock market sell-off
items.summary: However, the small-cap stock has fallen 10% in the past five trading sessions and over 36.53% in one month. The stock has declined around 7% since its listing in July this year.

items.title: Euro zone government bond yields mixed before Fed policy meeting
items.summary: Euro zone government bond yields were little changed on Tuesday as investors took a breather after pricing out a European Central Bank rate cut for 2026 on Monday.

items.title: Higher tariff on Indian rice will burden US consumers, India looking for new markets: Experts
items.summary: US tariffs on Indian rice are impacting American consumers. India continues to expand trade partnerships globally. Experts suggest US tariff threats are political, not policy. Indian rice exports remain resilient due to strong demand in other markets. The US remains a significant market for Indian Basmati rice, with demand growing for specific dishes.

items.title: FY27 will bring ‘substantial profits’ amid rising momentum: Prateek Maheshwari, PhysicsWallah
items.summary: PhysicsWallah is charting an optimistic course in the edtech sector, reporting a strong first half of FY26 with significant revenue and PAT growth. The company anticipates turning fully PAT positive by FY27, with its offline business also becoming EBITDA positive, driven by AI integration and cost efficiencies.

items.title: Smallcaps to face another tough year on earnings-valuations mismatch
items.summary: The underperformance of India's small-cap firms relative to large- and mid-caps this year, after two years of strong gains, is likely to persist into 2026 as stretched valuations, moderate earnings and thin liquidity continue to weigh, analysts said.

items.title: Steamhouse India files updated draft papers with SEBI; eyes ₹425 cr via IPO
items.summary: Led by promoter and CMD Vishal Budhia, Steamhouse India introduced the concept of community boiler systems in India in 2014

items.title: India’s Small & Medium REIT market poised to cross $ 75 billion: CBRE
items.summary: India's emerging SM REITs segment is projected to surpass USD 75 billion, backed by over 500 million sq. ft. of eligible assets. This initiative democratizes investment in mid-sized commercial properties, offering fractional ownership and potentially deepening institutionalization within the real estate sector.

items.title: DGCA flags IndiGo’s inability to operate approved schedule, orders a 5% cut in operations
items.summary: The regulator said that 15,014 departures per week were approved for the airline under the ‘Winter Schedule’, amounting to 64,346 flights for November 2025

items.summary: Welspun One has acquired a 46-acre land parcel in Pune's Talegaon from MIDC to develop a 1.2-million-sq-ft logistics park with a Rs 550 crore investment. This strategic expansion strengthens its presence in a key industrial hub, aiming to cater to high-growth sectors and enhance regional distribution capabilities.

items.title: Park Medi World IPO GMP signals 18% listing pop: Price band, key dates among 10 things to know ahead of offer launch

items.title: Chola reboots digital lending—this time on its own terms
items.summary: After scaling back its fintech-partner model in 2024 and eventually stopping it due to compliance complexity, governance concerns and the impact of small-ticket lending on borrowers, the company has re-entered the space with a fully in-house digital lending platform

items.title: Tata Motors share price jumps over 3.5% as Ambit Capital initiates coverage with 'buy' rating, sees 20% upside
items.summary: Tata Motors Commercial Vehicles shares rose 3.60% after Ambit Capital initiated coverage with a 'Buy' rating and a target of  ₹430. The brokerage cites strong M&amp;HCV positioning, operational improvements, and potential freight demand recovery as key factors for optimism.

items.title: Sahaj Insurance gets corporate agency licence from IRDAI, aims to sell 10 cr policies in 1st yr
items.summary: Sahaj Insurance Services, a subsidiary of Sahaj Retail, plans to offer 10 crore insurance policies to rural India. These policies will be simple, affordable, and accessible through Sahaj Centres. Trained Sahaj Mitrs will assist with onboarding, support, and claims. The initiative aims to deepen financial inclusion by integrating government schemes.

items.summary: K. V. Toys India's IPO opened on December 8, attracting significant interest from retail and institutional investors. The BSE SME IPO is witnessing healthy buying interest, while the grey market is indicating that the stock could be listed at a premium of over 30%.

He sees current dips as buying opportunities and remains bullish on financials, autos and quality growth stocks, while staying selective on healthcare and underweight IT and new-age tech due to limited visibility.

items.summary: Steamhouse India Ltd has filed its Updated Draft Red Herring Prospectus I (UDRHP I) with Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for a proposed IPO. The IPO — totaling up to ₹425 crore — will include a fresh share issue of ₹345 crore and an Offer For Sale (OFS) worth ₹80 crore by promoter Vishal Sanwarprasad Budhia.

items.title: India's aviation sector faces turbulence from fuel spike and weak rupee: JP Morgan
items.summary: The report, India Aviation Insights, notes that while domestic traffic has begun to improve after a weak second quarter, key cost variables, aviation turbine fuel and forex, pose significant challenges going forward

items.summary: The multibagger aviation stock crashed after a recent surge in widespread flight cancellations. This has led to a massive reduction in its market capitalisation from  ₹2,40,637.92 crore to  ₹1,87,379.08 crore, indicating a loss of  ₹53,258.84 crore in its valuation.

items.title: HRS Aluglaze's Rs 50.9 cr SME IPO to open on Dec 11
items.summary: HRS Aluglaze's Rs 50.9 crore initial public offering will open for subscription on December 11, closing on December 15. The company, specializing in aluminium products, aims to raise funds for working capital and setting up a new assembly line. The IPO, with a price band of Rs 94-96 per share, is set to list on BSE SME on December 18.

items.title: Building financial resilience: Why short-term planning deserves a bigger seat at the table
items.summary: Short-term financial stability is crucial for long-term wealth creation in India, especially amidst macro uncertainty. A structured short-term plan, utilizing instruments like corporate bonds, protects cash flows, limits behavioural mistakes, and provides the necessary breathing room for sustained investment growth.

items.title: Nifty 50 Trading Strategy: Analysts recommend Bear Put Spread options strategy for 16 December expiry
items.summary: Nifty 50 Trading Strategy: Axis Securities has suggested a Bear Put Spread strategy for Nifty options contracts expiring on 9 December 2025, forecasting a moderately bearish view.

items.title: Bitcoin slips nearly 2% in one day to $90,000. Here is what experts say
items.summary: Bitcoin and major altcoins declined over the past day, with BTC near $89,885 and Ethereum slightly lower at $3,104. Analysts warn of heightened volatility ahead as Bitcoin struggles to break past resistance around $92,000 while key support lies near $89,500–$88,800.

items.title: Karnataka High Court upholds premium FAR policy; dismisses petitions filed by TDR holders
items.summary: The Karnataka High Court has upheld the State's introduction of Premium Floor Area Ratio. This ruling validates the government's ability to collect charges for additional buildable rights. Landowners who received Transferable Development Rights previously challenged the policy. The court found Premium FAR and TDR to be complementary mechanisms.

items.title: GMR Airports plans about $245 million long-term bond sale: Report
items.summary: The airport operator aims to raise around 22 billion rupees ($245 million) through the sale of bonds maturing in 15 years, the sources said, requesting anonymity as the talks are still private.

items.title: Aviation Ministry deploys senior officers for on-ground inspection at 10 major airports
items.summary: The airports placed under this special inspection drive include Mumbai, Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Chennai, Ahmedabad, Pune, Guwahati, Goa and Thiruvananthapuram

items.title: As regulatory changes step up lending competition in India, private credit could prove its mettle and thrive
items.summary: Banks entering acquisition financing, overseas loans getting easier and other recent RBI enablers are converging to fuel credit competition in India. Where would this leave private credit? In a position to shake off its high-risk, high-cost image and shine through.

items.title: Ghost malls rise across India as ageing centres falter; repurposing emerges as solution
items.summary: Nearly one-fifth of India's shopping centers have become 'ghost malls' due to high vacancies and outdated assets.  A significant portion of this dormant space, however, holds potential for reinvigoration, offering substantial annual rental revenue.  This highlights a growing gap between top-performing and legacy malls, necessitating strategic interventions for future retail growth.

items.title: Urban Company not providing investors instant help to make gains on stock
items.summary: Urban Company Ltd's stock has plummeted to an all-time low, raising concerns among investors, with a crucial sell-off looming for anchor investors.

items.summary: Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu, addressing the IndiGo crisis in the Lok Sabha, said no airline—no matter how big—will be allowed to inconvenience passengers. He also stressed that safety in civil aviation remains absolutely non-negotiable.

items.title: Coforge share price: Mid-cap IT stock falls 5% even as brokerages see up to 54% upside - Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.summary: Coforge shares fell 5% despite brokerages maintaining bullish outlooks, forecasting a 54% upside. The company aims for a $2 billion revenue run-rate by Q4FY26, bolstered by disciplined execution and AI-driven strategies.

items.summary: Investors eagerly await the finalization of the Western Overseas Study Abroad IPO allotment, expected today. With a modest subscription rate, the stock's grey market premium suggests a muted debut. Learn how to check your allotment status and the next steps for successful bidders.

items.summary: Meesho, Aequs, and Vidya Wires debut tomorrow; Meesho leads in grey market premium, while Aequs offers balanced post-listing potential.

items.summary: Donald Trump's son-in-law, Jared Kushner's private equity fund Affinity Partners, is involved in Paramount's hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, competing with Netflix. The participation could have significant impact — here's how…

items.title: Novo Nordisk moves Delhi HC to block Sun Pharma as weight loss drug patent expiry looms
items.summary: Earlier, the court had declined Novo’s plea for an interim injunction against Dr Reddy’s Labs and permitted the company to manufacture and export semaglutide to non-patent countries until March 2026

items.title: Blinkit CEO warns India’s quick commerce bubble may be close to bursting
items.summary: A model that has so far relied on relentless fundraising is nearing its limits and companies will soon have to decide how long they can keep absorbing steep losses, says Blinkit Chief Executive Officer Albinder Dhindsa

items.title: Meesho IPO: GMP cools off to 29% but listing gains still expected to remain strong
items.summary: Meesho’s grey market premium (GMP) dipped slightly to 29%, yet the IPO is still expected to deliver strong listing-day gains. The Rs 5,421 crore issue was oversubscribed 81.76 times, with robust participation from QIBs, NIIs, and retail investors, highlighting confidence in Meesho’s zero-commission, asset-light e-commerce platform.

items.title: Over 4500 bags delivered, ₹827 crore refunded as IndiGo restores full momentum
items.summary: In a press release, the airline said it has restored connectivity to all stations in its network and significantly reduced cancellations through tighter planning and operational optimisation

items.title: Google-backed Namma Yatri to power ride-hailing platform Bharat Taxi’s zero-commission push
items.summary: Namma Yatri becomes technology partner for Bharat Taxi, a cooperative alternative to ride-hailing giants Uber and Ola. The collaboration emphasizes driver benefits and zero-commission structure and marks Namma Yatri's push into north India after successful operations in the south.

items.title: IndiGo’s disruptions could hit their fiscal numbers hard: Nidhi Dhruv
items.summary: IndiGo faces short-term headwinds due to operational disruptions and regulatory scrutiny, impacting its current fiscal year's performance. Moody's downgraded its human capital score, citing leadership concerns and pilot bargaining power, though the airline's long-term Baa3 rating remains stable due to its market dominance and India's aviation growth.

items.title: Jefferies revamps 2026 portfolio: Cuts Indigo; adds BPCL, Axis Bank, 4 other stocks
items.summary: Jefferies updates its India model portfolio for 2026, adding six stocks including Axis Bank, AU Small Finance Bank, BPCL, JSW Energy, Godrej Properties, and SAMIL, while removing ICICI Bank, NTPC, Tata Steel, Crompton Consumer, Belrise, and IndiGo.

items.title: Adventure deposits: A win-win-win proposition for India’s banking industry as interest rates decline
items.summary: In an environment of low interest rates that reward borrowers and punish savers, perhaps banks should be allowed to innovate. Depositors lured by capital markets may be ready to put money in ‘adventure deposits’ that offer higher returns for bearing some risk. It could be a triple-win.

items.title: Capex by CPSEs, 4 govt entities exceeds 64% of yearly target, NTPC achieved 100%
items.summary: One important reason for surge in capex during April-November period was very high spending by power sector companies

items.title: DGCA cuts IndiGo's flight schedules by 5%
items.summary: The flights have been cut across sectors, particularly on high-demand, high-frequency routes

items.title: HSBC on IndiGo: No structural damage, no de-rating. Here's all you need to know
items.summary: IndiGo’s worst operational meltdown led to thousands of cancellations, rising costs and reputational strain, but HSBC says the airline’s long-term fundamentals remain intact. The brokerage cut its target price but kept a ‘Buy’ rating, arguing that despite new pilot-duty rules and short-term disruptions, IndiGo’s cost advantage and market position are unchanged as operations begin to stabilise.

items.title: India's aviation sector faces turbulence from fuel spike and weak rupee: JP Morgan
items.summary: India's aviation sector sees demand picking up. However, rising jet fuel prices and a weaker rupee are creating challenges.  These cost increases could affect airline profits in the coming months.  While domestic airfares are stable, international fares have seen a significant jump.  Airlines are expanding capacity, but cost pressures remain a concern for profitability.

items.title: Leading Indian companies collaborate with Sweden's innovators to drive decarbonisation in steel, cement sectors
items.summary: Leading Indian firms like Tata Steel are partnering with Swedish tech firms. Seven projects are set to boost decarbonisation in India's steel and cement industries. These initiatives aim to support India's 2070 net-zero goal. Projects include hydrogen use in steelmaking and green cement production. This collaboration involves top Indian companies, research institutes, and Swedish technology leaders.

items.title: Global pilots warn India's rest rule exemption for IndiGo raises safety concerns
items.summary: The decision to grant the exemption to the rest rules is concerning because it is not based on scientific evidence, says Captain Ron Hay, president of the Montreal-based International Federation of Air Line Pilots’ Associations

items.title: Ford to use Renault technology, plants for cheaper European EVs to fend off Chinese rivals
items.summary: Renault and Ford have formed a major partnership to jointly develop small, low-cost electric vehicles and commercial vans for the European market, aiming to cut costs and counter growing competition from Chinese automakers. The first jointly developed small EV—built at a Renault plant in northern France—is expected to hit European showrooms in 2028, filling a key gap in Ford’s lineup.

items.title: 8th pay commission: Govt shares major update in Lok Sabha. Here's what’s next for employees and pensioners
items.summary: The government has confirmed that over 50.14 lakh Central employees and 69 lakh pensioners will fall under the 8th Central Pay Commission (CPC), though the timing of its implementation and funding will be decided later. Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary informed Parliament that the 8th CPC has already been constituted, with its Terms of Reference notified on November 3, 2025.

items.title: Nuvama Wealth fixes December 26 record date for first-ever stock split
items.summary: Nuvama Wealth Management will execute a 1:5 stock split on December 26, 2025, after shareholder approval. Each ₹10 share will be split into five ₹2 shares, with no change in total investment value for shareholders.

items.title: Govt clears two fund managers to roll out  ₹1 trillion deep-tech RDI scheme
items.summary: The first tranche of startup applications under the RDI scheme is expected by March 2026, following approvals for Birac and TDB and the near-finalization of Sidbi and SBI-AIF as fund managers.

items.title: Reddit down for second day in a row, reports on Downdetector show
items.summary: Social networking platform Reddit was reported to be down for second day in a row on 9 December, according to multiple user reports on Downdetector.

items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
